description:
A component for displaying color contrast between two colors. It will perform checks according to the [WCAG 2.1 standard](https://webaim.org/articles/contrast/#ratio), determining if a given contrast ratio is acceptable for `normal`, `large` or `graphics` texts. `normal` needs to be `4.5`, the other two `3`. ### Color Contrast ```js --- type: example --- ``` ### In-line Color setting ```js --- type: example --- const Example = () => { const [selectedForeGround, setSelectedForeGround] = useState('#0CBF94') const [selectedBackGround, setSelectedBackGround] = useState('#35423A') const [validationLevel, setValidationLevel] = useState('AA') return (
setValidationLevel(value)} name="example1" defaultValue="AA" description="validationLevel" > setSelectedBackGround(selectedBackGround) } /> setSelectedForeGround(selectedForeGround) } />
console.log(contrastData)} />
) } render() ```

elementRef.description: Provides a reference to the component's underlying html element.

failureLabel.description: Text of the failure indicator (Suggested english text: FAIL)

firstColor.description: The first color to compare (HEX code)

firstColorLabel.description: The name of the first color which will be compared

graphicsTextLabel.description: Text of the third check (Suggested english text: Graphics text)

largeTextLabel.description: Text of the second check (Suggested english text: Large text)

normalTextLabel.description: Text of the first check (Suggested english text: Normal text)

secondColor.description: The second color to compare (HEX code)

secondColorLabel.description: The name of the second color which will be compared

successLabel.description: Text of the success indicator (Suggested english text: PASS)

withoutColorPreview.description:
Toggles the color preview part of the component.

If true, firstColorLabel and secondColorLabel is not necessary.
Otherwise, it is required.

onContrastChange.description:
Triggers a callback whenever the contrast changes, due to a changing color input.
Communicates the contrast and the success/fail state of the contrast, depending on
the situation:

isValidNormalText true if at least 4.5:1

isValidLargeText true if at least 3:1

isValidGraphicsText true if at least 3:1

validationLevel.description:
According to WCAG 2.2

AA level (https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/#contrast-minimum)

text: 4.5:1

large text: 3:1

non-text: 3:1 (https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/#non-text-contrast)


AAA level (https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/#contrast-enhanced)

text: 7:1

large text: 4.5:1

non-text: 3:1 (https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/#non-text-contrast)
